measured_by: short form of the Hagen Matrices Test
justification: “To assess cognitive ability, we used the short form of the Hagen Matrices Test (Heydasch et al., 2013).”

measured_by: looking time proportion (time spent viewing complex vs. simple option)
justification: “we further implemented two process measures of cognitive effort, looking time proportion (i.e., time spent looking at the complex option divided by time spent looking at the simple option)….”

measured_by: decision speed (number of decisions per minute)
justification: “and decision speed, defined as 60 =  … The extended model revealed an interaction between LTP and complexity … in contrast, there was no credible interaction between complexity and decision speed.” (decision speed is explicitly introduced as a process measure of cognitive effort).

measured_by: binary choice task between simple and complex lotteries
justification: “In the choice task, participants chose the lottery they preferred out of two options … This allowed us to measure … whether complex gambles were chosen less often than simple gambles.”

measured_by: valuation task using minimum selling price (BDM auction)
justification: “In the valuation task, participants indicated their minimum selling price … The valuation task was incentivized on the basis of a Becker-DeGroot-Marschak (BDM) auction … allowing us to test whether complex options were valued less than simple ones.”

measured_by: mean estimation task for each lottery
justification: “In the estimation block, participants had to estimate the mean of the presented lotteries … this task allowed us to examine the effect of complexity on a perceptual level.”
